subject: I'd like to be able to write the prefixes com- and con- as contractions
msgSnippet: I have made good progress in QuikScipt. Learned to read and write all 40+ characters, learned joined letters like ar, or, etc., contractions for words,
messageBody:
I have made good progress in QuikScipt. Learned to read and write all
40+ characters, learned joined letters like ar, or, etc., contractions
for words, suffixes and prefixes.

I'd like to understand how to write the prefixes com- and con- which are
found in innumerable words in the English language. Writing k and o
together is troublesome enough, but adding the third letter is the hard
part. Most of the other prefixes and suffixes can be written with
characters joined to form one combined character easy to write and
readily recognizable. Is there a simplified way of writing com- ? Would
it be acceptable to use just k- with the hyphen to represent both com-
and con- as contraction for the full prefix?
